Condition 1: I assume we operate within the set of positive numbers. For the result to be the highest, the sum of the five numbers must be the smallest, i.e. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. Their sum is 15, so 50 − 15 = 35. To maximize the product, this should be multiplied by the highest number in the set, 50. Result: 35 × 50 = 1750
